Comment: Useful things to know:  * [REAL ID](https://www.dhs.gov/real-id) deadline for domestic US travel is May 7, 2025. If your US driver's license doesn't have a big star in the upper right corner, it's not a REAL ID. A REAL ID says you're a US citizen, and mostly immune to ICE detention. At airports, there are some other acceptable IDs, but expect some additional hassle and delay.  * Married women who changed their name when married may have to prove all name changes since birth to get a REAL ID. So dig up all those old marriage and divorce certificates. * A REAL ID may be required to enter some government buildings and installations.  * A REAL ID is *not* required to buy a gun.

Comment: REAL ID doesn't prove citizenship, you need an Enganced ID which is only produced in certain states.  The star only indicates that certain security checks were performed and it contains specific security features. Non-citizen residents can obtain a REAL ID when they apply for a driver's license. (Source, the internet and my husband's REAL ID from before he was a US citizen)
